data: Honours for the Emperor Septimius Severus
Large tablet of limestone, broken into nine joining fragments, with a small fragment missing from the upper left part of the field. The tablet has a moulded frame.
The text is among those originally displayed in the Palazzo delle Aquile
Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.
Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae

Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del Museo di Palermo
Livia Bivona, Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del Museo di Palermo, Sikelia 5 (Palermo: Flaccovio, 1970)
A propos du récent catalogue d'inscriptions latines du musée de Palerme
M.-Th. Raepsaet-Charlier, « A propos du récent catalogue d’inscriptions latines du musée de Palerme », Latomus 33 (1974): 124‑27
La Sicilia da Sesto Pompeo a Diocleziano
Giacomo Manganaro, «La Sicilia da Sesto Pompeo a Diocleziano», Aufstieg und Niedergang der romischen Welt 2.11.1 (1988): 3–89
Raepsaet-Charlier, 1974, A propos du récent catalogue d'inscriptions latines du musée de Palerme

Large tablet of limestone, broken into nine joining fragments, with a small fragment missing from the upper left part of the field. The tablet has a moulded frame.

limestone base 82.5 73 3-4 chiselled Line 1 Interlineation line 1 to 2 Panhormus Palermo 38.13205, 13.33561 1st July—9th December 198 CE The text is among those originally displayed in the Palazzo delle Aquile None
